captions.text:
You’ve seen Thor, the film that tided fans
over until The Avengers

Now experience the film that will tide fans
over until The Avengers 2:

Thor is back in another perfectly adequate
Marvel movie that pleasantly killed a few

with enough cool visuals, action, and humor
to keep you from wondering:

why does the elf man want to shoot magic Kool-Aid
into the sky holes?

Return for another post-Avengers movie full
of references to the Avengers

Instead of Earth’s mightiest heroes, watch
Thor team up once again with

Heimdall, the watchful guardian who can see
everything

and this gigantic spaceship directly above
him.

The Warriors Three, who are so replaceable
they switched out one of the actors and you

And everyone’s favorite, Loki, the charismatic
trickster who no one should trust by now.

When he’s not battling another forgettable
bad guy, watch as the mighty Thor mopes around

because he’s still hung up on a girl he
spent one long weekend with and hasn't called

Natalie Portman returns as Jean Grey from
the X-Men Phoenix saga
With the help of her wacky sidekick,
and her other wacky sidekick’s wacky sidekick,

a piece of science mumbo-jumbo everyone keeps
trying to explain.
"Once a cycle, all the worlds align."

"The alignment is only temporary. You must
be in exactly the right place at the right

"Physics is gonna go ballistic! Increases
and decreases in gravity, spatial extrusions--"

Whatever. Can we just see Thor hit something
with a hammer again?
Travel across the 9 realms, ranging from Earth

home of the most penetrable impenetrable city
ever.
So ride along with the god of Thunder

... so ride along with the Guy of Thunder,
for another celebration of the male form in

title: Honest Trailers - Thor: The Dark World

comments.author: Nay Mata

comments.text:
For me the only thing keeping the Thor movies together is actually the 
relationship between Thor and Loki. That's the thing I enjoyed the most in 
this movie, them working together as a team, a highly dysfunctional, fucked 
up but effective team.
And yeah, I really hope that in the third one they'll limit(cut off) the 
Earth screen time thing. I mean honestly, everybody would rather like to 
see them somewhere else(anywhere else) than there. It's simply boring and 
annoying.﻿

comments.text:
I've long accepted that Marvel's Norse gods will never be the Norse gods. I 
mean, Loki thinking he's an Asgardian? Really? That asshole was a Jotun, is 
a Jotun, and will always be a Jotun who is one of the Aesir.  

Fun Fact: Loki fathered Hela, the queen of the Underworld, the Midgard 
Serpent, and Fenrir.  He also killed Balder, who is the blond guy who's 
actor they switched out. Look it up.﻿
